page.title: 07SPINAL UNIT,ODSTOCK HOSPITAL
page.content: The unit has 48 beds,each designed to give the patients spine the maximum support possible. This unit is not very exspensive to maintain. Treatment of the patients includes _{ {EURODYNAMICS}=Exploring how badly patients nerves are damaged. This equipment costs about Â£60,000. They also stimulate muscles,to move by artificial electronuc signals that mimic real ones sent before the nerves were damaged. The people accepted for this treatment come from as far away as Cornwall,along the coast to Portsmouth,and up to Swindon & parts of South Wales(A few patients are accepted from Stoke Mandeville). Advances probable in the future are improvements in muscle stimulation, involving techniques that may enable some to walk again.35 skilled people work there.
